solution_line_template: First, we perform {anniversary_target}-{years_before_anniversary}=<<{anniversary_target}-{years_before_anniversary}={target_years_from_built}>>{target_years_from_built} to find the number of total years from the building being built that we're looking for.

Then, we subtract out the {years_ago_built} years that have already passed to determine the remaining amount of time, performing {target_years_from_built}-{years_ago_built}= <<{target_years_from_built}-{years_ago_built}={years_in_future}>>{years_in_future} years in the future.
